        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/308dc4497d5925d27f219939e1b6876f5e33764e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/308dc4497d5925d27f219939e1b6876f5e33764e"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/308dc4497d5925d27f219939e1b6876f5e33764e<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>308dc4497d5925d27f219939e1b6876f5e33764e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/308dc4497d5925d27f219939e1b6876f5e33764e"><!---->308dc4497d5925d27f219939e1b6876f5e33764e<!----></a><br>Author: Yongshun Liu <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Yongshun Liu &lt;<!----></span>yongshun@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/yongshun@chromium.org"><!---->yongshun@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed Oct 26 21:05:38 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Oct 26 21:05:38 2022<!----></span><br><br>[Merge to M108] saved_desks: Fix hide/show for overview item window and app window<span class="line"><!---->[Merge to M108] saved_desks: Fix hide/show for overview item window and app window<!----></span><br><br>This fixes 2 issues.<span class="line"><!---->This fixes 2 issues.<!----></span><br><br>1. Wrong shadow and header for the overview item when launching a<span class="line"><!---->1. Wrong shadow and header for the overview item when launching a<!----></span><br>template.<span class="line"><!---->template.<!----></span><br><br>During the launch process of a template, a new `OverviewItem` will be<span class="line"><!---->During the launch process of a template, a new `OverviewItem` will be<!----></span><br>added to the `OverviewGrid`. Since the library widget fade out animation<span class="line"><!---->added to the `OverviewGrid`. Since the library widget fade out animation<!----></span><br>takes precedence, the overview item window is hidden until the fade out<span class="line"><!---->takes precedence, the overview item window is hidden until the fade out<!----></span><br>animation is done, then the hide will be reverted. The problem is its<span class="line"><!---->animation is done, then the hide will be reverted. The problem is its<!----></span><br>shadow and header might not be sync'ed with the overview item window.<span class="line"><!---->shadow and header might not be sync'ed with the overview item window.<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to make sure the header and shadow show up only when the<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to make sure the header and shadow show up only when the<!----></span><br>overview item window is visible, and update the header and shadow when<span class="line"><!---->overview item window is visible, and update the header and shadow when<!----></span><br>reverting after the fade out animation.<span class="line"><!---->reverting after the fade out animation.<!----></span><br><br>2. Overview session unexpectedly being turned off when launching a<span class="line"><!---->2. Overview session unexpectedly being turned off when launching a<!----></span><br>template<span class="line"><!---->template<!----></span><br><br>So now we hide the real application window when in library view, this is<span class="line"><!---->So now we hide the real application window when in library view, this is<!----></span><br>to make sure dark/light change does not make it visible. However, when<span class="line"><!---->to make sure dark/light change does not make it visible. However, when<!----></span><br>we are reverting the hide, and still want to stay in overview, like when<span class="line"><!---->we are reverting the hide, and still want to stay in overview, like when<!----></span><br>launching a template, since overview session detects a window activation<span class="line"><!---->launching a template, since overview session detects a window activation<!----></span><br>event, the session would be soon turned off.<span class="line"><!---->event, the session would be soon turned off.<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to let `OverviewSession` ignore the activation for such<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to let `OverviewSession` ignore the activation for such<!----></span><br>window in `OnWindowActivating`. This also fixes the heap-use-after-free<span class="line"><!---->window in `OnWindowActivating`. This also fixes the heap-use-after-free<!----></span><br>security bug caused by overview session being turned off unexpectedly.<span class="line"><!---->security bug caused by overview session being turned off unexpectedly.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>aca00c63fdbf7d795929207bdb5aa25ddf73db3d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/aca00c63fdbf7d795929207bdb5aa25ddf73db3d"><!---->aca00c63fdbf7d795929207bdb5aa25ddf73db3d<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>Test: Manual<span class="line"><!---->Test: Manual<!----></span><br>Bug:<span class="line"><!---->Bug:<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>b/254338856<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://b/254338856"><!---->b/254338856<!----></a><br>Bug: 1372757<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1372757" title="Security: Heap-use-after-free in ash::OverviewItem::ShowWindowInOverview"><!---->Bug: 1372757<!----></a><br>Change-Id: Ib326f84dd4aa96b0ba9417dc3217c70f3cedcf95<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: Ib326f84dd4aa96b0ba9417dc3217c70f3cedcf95<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3965350<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      </style>
      
      
    <!----></mr-launch-overview>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;

          width: 100%;

        }

          padding: 0;

          flex-wrap: nowrap;

        }

          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;

          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;

        }

          min-width: 256px;

          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }

          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);

          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        So it seems that in this case, when ShowWindowInOverview is doing its thing, it ends up shutting down overview mode, which means the object is destroyed.<span class="line"><!---->So it seems that in this case, when ShowWindowInOverview is doing its thing, it ends up shutting down overview mode, which means the object is destroyed.<!----></span><br><br>ScopedOverviewHideWindows::RemoveWindow, through a roundabout way, ends up activating a window and this causes overview mode to exit.<span class="line"><!---->ScopedOverviewHideWindows::RemoveWindow, through a roundabout way, ends up activating a window and this causes overview mode to exit.<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/wm/overview/overview_item.cc;l=1459;drc=fe9bb2cbc239b5aa37a4b59bc38f1f022b6f36b8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/wm/overview/overview_item.cc;l=1459;drc=fe9bb2cbc239b5aa37a4b59bc38f1f022b6f36b8"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/wm/overview/overview_item.cc;l=1459;drc=fe9bb2cbc239b5aa37a4b59bc38f1f022b6f36b8<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

Wrong shadow and header for the overview item when launching a<span class="line"><!---->1. Wrong shadow and header for the overview item when launching a<!----></span><br>template.<span class="line"><!---->template.<!----></span><br><br>During the launch process of a template, a new `OverviewItem` will be<span class="line"><!---->During the launch process of a template, a new `OverviewItem` will be<!----></span><br>added to the `OverviewGrid`. Since the library widget fade out animation<span class="line"><!---->added to the `OverviewGrid`. Since the library widget fade out animation<!----></span><br>takes precedence, the overview item window is hidden until the fade out<span class="line"><!---->takes precedence, the overview item window is hidden until the fade out<!----></span><br>animation is done, then the hide will be reverted. The problem is its<span class="line"><!---->animation is done, then the hide will be reverted. The problem is its<!----></span><br>shadow and header might not be sync'ed with the overview item window.<span class="line"><!---->shadow and header might not be sync'ed with the overview item window.<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to make sure the header and shadow show up only when the<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to make sure the header and shadow show up only when the<!----></span><br>overview item window is visible, and update the header and shadow when<span class="line"><!---->overview item window is visible, and update the header and shadow when<!----></span><br>reverting after the fade out animation.<span class="line"><!---->reverting after the fade out animation.<!----></span><br><br>2. Overview session unexpectedly being turned off when launching a<span class="line"><!---->2. Overview session unexpectedly being turned off when launching a<!----></span><br>template<span class="line"><!---->template<!----></span><br><br>So now we hide the real application window when in library view, this is<span class="line"><!---->So now we hide the real application window when in library view, this is<!----></span><br>to make sure dark/light change does not make it visible. However, when<span class="line"><!---->to make sure dark/light change does not make it visible. However, when<!----></span><br>we are reverting the hide, and still want to stay in overview, like when<span class="line"><!---->we are reverting the hide, and still want to stay in overview, like when<!----></span><br>launching a template, since overview session detects a window activation<span class="line"><!---->launching a template, since overview session detects a window activation<!----></span><br>event, the session would be soon turned off.<span class="line"><!---->event, the session would be soon turned off.<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to let `OverviewSession` ignore the activation for such<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to let `OverviewSession` ignore the activation for such<!----></span><br>window in `OnWindowActivating`. This also fixes the heap-use-after-free<span class="line"><!---->window in `OnWindowActivating`. This also fixes the heap-use-after-free<!----></span><br>security bug caused by overview session being turned off unexpectedly.<span class="line"><!---->security bug caused by overview session being turned off unexpectedly.<!----></span><br><br>Test: Manual<span class="line"><!---->Test: Manual<!----></span><br>Bug:<span class="line"><!---->Bug:<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> Wrong shadow and header for the overview item when launching a<span class="line"><!---->1. Wrong shadow and header for the overview item when launching a<!----></span><br>template.<span class="line"><!---->template.<!----></span><br><br>During the launch process of a template, a new `OverviewItem` will be<span class="line"><!---->During the launch process of a template, a new `OverviewItem` will be<!----></span><br>added to the `OverviewGrid`. Since the library widget fade out animation<span class="line"><!---->added to the `OverviewGrid`. Since the library widget fade out animation<!----></span><br>takes precedence, the overview item window is hidden until the fade out<span class="line"><!---->takes precedence, the overview item window is hidden until the fade out<!----></span><br>animation is done, then the hide will be reverted. The problem is its<span class="line"><!---->animation is done, then the hide will be reverted. The problem is its<!----></span><br>shadow and header might not be sync'ed with the overview item window.<span class="line"><!---->shadow and header might not be sync'ed with the overview item window.<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to make sure the header and shadow show up only when the<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to make sure the header and shadow show up only when the<!----></span><br>overview item window is visible, and update the header and shadow when<span class="line"><!---->overview item window is visible, and update the header and shadow when<!----></span><br>reverting after the fade out animation.<span class="line"><!---->reverting after the fade out animation.<!----></span><br><br>2. Overview session unexpectedly being turned off when launching a<span class="line"><!---->2. Overview session unexpectedly being turned off when launching a<!----></span><br>template<span class="line"><!---->template<!----></span><br><br>So now we hide the real application window when in library view, this is<span class="line"><!---->So now we hide the real application window when in library view, this is<!----></span><br>to make sure dark/light change does not make it visible. However, when<span class="line"><!---->to make sure dark/light change does not make it visible. However, when<!----></span><br>we are reverting the hide, and still want to stay in overview, like when<span class="line"><!---->we are reverting the hide, and still want to stay in overview, like when<!----></span><br>launching a template, since overview session detects a window activation<span class="line"><!---->launching a template, since overview session detects a window activation<!----></span><br>event, the session would be soon turned off.<span class="line"><!---->event, the session would be soon turned off.<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to let `OverviewSession` ignore the activation for such<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to let `OverviewSession` ignore the activation for such<!----></span><br>window in `OnWindowActivating`. This also fixes the heap-use-after-free<span class="line"><!---->window in `OnWindowActivating`. This also fixes the heap-use-after-free<!----></span><br>security bug caused by overview session being turned off unexpectedly.<span class="line"><!---->security bug caused by overview session being turned off unexpectedly.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>aca00c63fdbf7d795929207bdb5aa25ddf73db3d<a class="undefined"           <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        LTS Milestone M102<span class="line"><!---->LTS Milestone M102<!----></span><br><br>This issue has been flagged as a merge candidate for Chrome OS' LTS channel. If selected, our merge team will handle any additional merges. To help us determine if this issue requires a merge to LTS, please answer this short questionnaire:<span class="line"><!---->This issue has been flagged as a merge candidate for Chrome OS' LTS channel. If selected, our merge team will handle any additional merges. To help us determine if this issue requires a merge to LTS, please answer this short questionnaire:<!----></span><br>1. Was this issue a regression for the milestone it was found in?<span class="line"><!---->1. Was this issue a regression for the milestone it was found in?<!----></span><br>2. Is this issue related to a change or feature merged after the latest LTS Milestone?<span class="line"><!---->2.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        So it seems that in this case, when ShowWindowInOverview is doing its thing, it ends up shutting down overview mode, which means the object is destroyed.<span class="line"><!---->So it seems that in this case, when ShowWindowInOverview is doing its thing, it ends up shutting down overview mode, which means the object is destroyed.<!----></span><br><br>ScopedOverviewHideWindows::RemoveWindow, through a roundabout way, ends up activating a window and this causes overview mode to exit.<span class="line"><!---->ScopedOverviewHideWindows::RemoveWindow, through a roundabout way, ends up activating a window and this causes overview mode to exit.<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/wm/overview/overview_item.cc;l=1459;drc=fe9bb2cbc239b5aa37a4b59bc38f1f022b6f36b8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/wm/overview/overview_item.cc;l=1459;drc=fe9bb2cbc239b5aa37a4b59bc38f1f022b6f36b8"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/wm/overview/overview_item.cc;l=1459;drc=fe9bb2cbc239b5aa37a4b59bc38f1f022b6f36b8<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/aca00c63fdbf7d795929207bdb5aa25ddf73db3d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/aca00c63fdbf7d795929207bdb5aa25ddf73db3d"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/aca00c63fdbf7d795929207bdb5aa25ddf73db3d<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>aca00c63fdbf7d795929207bdb5aa25ddf73db3d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/aca00c63fdbf7d795929207bdb5aa25ddf73db3d"><!---->aca00c63fdbf7d795929207bdb5aa25ddf73db3d<!----></a><br>Author: Yongshun Liu <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Yongshun Liu &lt;<!----></span>yongshun@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/yongshun@chromium.org"><!---->yongshun@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Mon Oct 24 22:22:33 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Mon Oct 24 22:22:33 2022<!----></span><br><br>saved_desks: Fix hide/show for overview item window and app window<span class="line"><!---->saved_desks: Fix hide/show for overview item window and app window<!----></span><br><br>This fixes 2 issues.<span class="line"><!---->This fixes 2 issues.<!----></span><br><br>1. Wrong shadow and header for the overview item when launching a<span class="line"><!---->1. Wrong shadow and header for the overview item when launching a<!----></span><br>template.<span class="line"><!---->template.<!----></span><br><br>During the launch process of a template, a new `OverviewItem` will be<span class="line"><!---->During the launch process of a template, a new `OverviewItem` will be<!----></span><br>added to the `OverviewGrid`. Since the library widget fade out animation<span class="line"><!---->added to the `OverviewGrid`. Since the library widget fade out animation<!----></span><br>takes precedence, the overview item window is hidden until the fade out<span class="line"><!---->takes precedence, the overview item window is hidden until the fade out<!----></span><br>animation is done, then the hide will be reverted. The problem is its<span class="line"><!---->animation is done, then the hide will be reverted. The problem is its<!----></span><br>shadow and header might not be sync'ed with the overview item window.<span class="line"><!---->shadow and header might not be sync'ed with the overview item window.<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to make sure the header and shadow show up only when the<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to make sure the header and shadow show up only when the<!----></span><br>overview item window is visible, and update the header and shadow when<span class="line"><!---->overview item window is visible, and update the header and shadow when<!----></span><br>reverting after the fade out animation.<span class="line"><!---->reverting after the fade out animation.<!----></span><br><br>2. Overview session unexpectedly being turned off when launching a<span class="line"><!---->2. Overview session unexpectedly being turned off when launching a<!----></span><br>template<span class="line"><!---->template<!----></span><br><br>So now we hide the real application window when in library view, this is<span class="line"><!---->So now we hide the real application window when in library view, this is<!----></span><br>to make sure dark/light change does not make it visible. However, when<span class="line"><!---->to make sure dark/light change does not make it visible. However, when<!----></span><br>we are reverting the hide, and still want to stay in overview, like when<span class="line"><!---->we are reverting the hide, and still want to stay in overview, like when<!----></span><br>launching a template, since overview session detects a window activation<span class="line"><!---->launching a template, since overview session detects a window activation<!----></span><br>event, the session would be soon turned off.<span class="line"><!---->event, the session would be soon turned off.<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to let `OverviewSession` ignore the activation for such<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to let `OverviewSession` ignore the activation for such<!----></span><br>window in `OnWindowActivating`. This also fixes the heap-use-after-free<span class="line"><!---->window in `OnWindowActivating`. This also fixes the heap-use-after-free<!----></span><br>security bug caused by overview session being turned off unexpectedly.<span class="line"><!---->security bug caused by overview session being turned off unexpectedly.<!----></span><br><br>Test: Manual<span class="line"><!---->Test: Manual<!----></span><br>Bug:<span class="line"><!---->Bug:<!----></span> <span class="line"><!---->         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/308dc4497d5925d27f219939e1b6876f5e33764e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/308dc4497d5925d27f219939e1b6876f5e33764e"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/308dc4497d5925d27f219939e1b6876f5e33764e<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>308dc4497d5925d27f219939e1b6876f5e33764e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/308dc4497d5925d27f219939e1b6876f5e33764e"><!---->308dc4497d5925d27f219939e1b6876f5e33764e<!----></a><br>Author: Yongshun Liu <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Yongshun Liu &lt;<!----></span>yongshun@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/yongshun@chromium.org"><!---->yongshun@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed Oct 26 21:05:38 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Oct 26 21:05:38 2022<!----></span><br><br>[Merge to M108] saved_desks: Fix hide/show for overview item window and app window<span class="line"><!---->[Merge to M108] saved_desks: Fix hide/show for overview item window and app window<!----></span><br><br>This fixes 2 issues.<span class="line"><!---->This fixes 2 issues.<!----></span><br><br>1. Wrong shadow and header for the overview item when launching a<span class="line"><!---->1. Wrong shadow and header for the overview item when launching a<!----></span><br>template.<span class="line"><!---->template.<!----></span><br><br>During the launch process of a template, a new `OverviewItem` will be<span class="line"><!---->During the launch process of a template, a new `OverviewItem` will be<!----></span><br>added to the `OverviewGrid`. Since the library widget fade out animation<span class="line"><!---->added to the `OverviewGrid`. Since the library widget fade out animation<!----></span><br>takes precedence, the overview item window is hidden until the fade out<span class="line"><!---->takes precedence, the overview item window is hidden until the fade out<!----></span><br>animation is done, then the hide will be reverted. The problem is its<span class="line"><!---->animation is done, then the hide will be reverted. The problem is its<!----></span><br>shadow and header might not be sync'ed with the overview item window.<span class="line"><!---->shadow and header might not be sync'ed with the overview item window.<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to make sure the header and shadow show up only when the<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to make sure the header and shadow show up only when the<!----></span><br>overview item window is visible, and update the header and shadow when<span class="line"><!---->overview item window is visible, and update the header and shadow when<!----></span><br>reverting after the fade out animation.<span class="line"><!---->reverting after the fade out animation.<!----></span><br><br>2. Overview session unexpectedly being turned off when launching a<span class="line"><!---->2. Overview session unexpectedly being turned off when launching a<!----></span><br>template<span class="line"><!---->template<!----></span><br><br>So now we hide the real application window when in library view, this is<span class="line"><!---->So now we hide the real application window when in library view, this is<!----></span><br>to make sure dark/light change does not make it visible. However, when<span class="line"><!---->to make sure dark/light change does not make it visible. However, when<!----></span><br>we are reverting the hide, and still want to stay in overview, like when<span class="line"><!---->we are reverting the hide, and still want to stay in overview, like when<!----></span><br>launching a template, since overview session detects a window activation<span class="line"><!---->launching a template, since overview session detects a window activation<!----></span><br>event, the session would be soon turned off.<span class="line"><!---->event, the session would be soon turned off.<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to let `OverviewSession` ignore the activation for such<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to let `OverviewSession` ignore the activation for such<!----></span><br>window in `OnWindowActivating`. This also fixes the heap-use-after-free<span class="line"><!---->window in `OnWindowActivating`. This also fixes the heap-use-after-free<!----></span><br>security bug caused by overview session being turned off unexpectedly.<span class="line"><!---->security bug caused by overview session being turned off unexpectedly.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>aca00c63fdbf7d795929207bdb5aa25ddf73db3d<a class="undefined"         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        So it seems that in this case, when ShowWindowInOverview is doing its thing, it ends up shutting down overview mode, which means the object is destroyed.<span class="line"><!---->So it seems that in this case, when ShowWindowInOverview is doing its thing, it ends up shutting down overview mode, which means the object is destroyed.<!----></span><br><br>ScopedOverviewHideWindows::RemoveWindow, through a roundabout way, ends up activating a window and this causes overview mode to exit.<span class="line"><!---->ScopedOverviewHideWindows::RemoveWindow, through a roundabout way, ends up activating a window and this causes overview mode to exit.<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/wm/overview/overview_item.cc;l=1459;drc=fe9bb2cbc239b5aa37a4b59bc38f1f022b6f36b8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/wm/overview/overview_item.cc;l=1459;drc=fe9bb2cbc239b5aa37a4b59bc38f1f022b6f36b8"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/wm/overview/overview_item.cc;l=1459;drc=fe9bb2cbc239b5aa37a4b59bc38f1f022b6f36b8<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/aca00c63fdbf7d795929207bdb5aa25ddf73db3d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/aca00c63fdbf7d795929207bdb5aa25ddf73db3d"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/aca00c63fdbf7d795929207bdb5aa25ddf73db3d<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>aca00c63fdbf7d795929207bdb5aa25ddf73db3d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/aca00c63fdbf7d795929207bdb5aa25ddf73db3d"><!---->aca00c63fdbf7d795929207bdb5aa25ddf73db3d<!----></a><br>Author: Yongshun Liu <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Yongshun Liu &lt;<!----></span>yongshun@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/yongshun@chromium.org"><!---->yongshun@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Mon Oct 24 22:22:33 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Mon Oct 24 22:22:33 2022<!----></span><br><br>saved_desks: Fix hide/show for overview item window and app window<span class="line"><!---->saved_desks: Fix hide/show for overview item window and app window<!----></span><br><br>This fixes 2 issues.<span class="line"><!---->This fixes 2 issues.<!----></span><br><br>1. Wrong shadow and header for the overview item when launching a<span class="line"><!---->1. Wrong shadow and header for the overview item when launching a<!----></span><br>template.<span class="line"><!---->template.<!----></span><br><br>During the launch process of a template, a new `OverviewItem` will be<span class="line"><!---->During the launch process of a template, a new `OverviewItem` will be<!----></span><br>added to the `OverviewGrid`. Since the library widget fade out animation<span class="line"><!---->added to the `OverviewGrid`. Since the library widget fade out animation<!----></span><br>takes precedence, the overview item window is hidden until the fade out<span class="line"><!---->takes precedence, the overview item window is hidden until the fade out<!----></span><br>animation is done, then the hide will be reverted. The problem is its<span class="line"><!---->animation is done, then the hide will be reverted. The problem is its<!----></span><br>shadow and header might not be sync'ed with the overview item window.<span class="line"><!---->shadow and header might not be sync'ed with the overview item window.<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to make sure the header and shadow show up only when the<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to make sure the header and shadow show up only when the<!----></span><br>overview item window is visible, and update the header and shadow when<span class="line"><!---->overview item window is visible, and update the header and shadow when<!----></span><br>reverting after the fade out animation.<span class="line"><!---->reverting after the fade out animation.<!----></span><br><br>2. Overview session unexpectedly being turned off when launching a<span class="line"><!---->2. Overview session unexpectedly being turned off when launching a<!----></span><br>template<span class="line"><!---->template<!----></span><br><br>So now we hide the real application window when in library view, this is<span class="line"><!---->So now we hide the real application window when in library view, this is<!----></span><br>to make sure dark/light change does not make it visible. However, when<span class="line"><!---->to make sure dark/light change does not make it visible. However, when<!----></span><br>we are reverting the hide, and still want to stay in overview, like when<span class="line"><!---->we are reverting the hide, and still want to stay in overview, like when<!----></span><br>launching a template, since overview session detects a window activation<span class="line"><!---->launching a template, since overview session detects a window activation<!----></span><br>event, the session would be soon turned off.<span class="line"><!---->event, the session would be soon turned off.<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to let `OverviewSession` ignore the activation for such<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to let `OverviewSession` ignore the activation for such<!----></span><br>window in `OnWindowActivating`. This also fixes the heap-use-after-free<span class="line"><!---->window in `OnWindowActivating`. This also fixes the heap-use-after-free<!----></span><br>security bug caused by overview session being turned off unexpectedly.<span class="line"><!---->security bug caused by overview session being turned off unexpectedly.<!----></span><br><br>Test: Manual<span class="line"><!---->Test: Manual<!----></span><br>Bug:<span class="line"><!---->Bug:<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>b/254338856<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://b/254338856"><!---->b/254338856<!----></a><br>Bug: 1372757<a class="strike-through" target="_blank"         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/308dc4497d5925d27f219939e1b6876f5e33764e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/308dc4497d5925d27f219939e1b6876f5e33764e"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/308dc4497d5925d27f219939e1b6876f5e33764e<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>308dc4497d5925d27f219939e1b6876f5e33764e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/308dc4497d5925d27f219939e1b6876f5e33764e"><!---->308dc4497d5925d27f219939e1b6876f5e33764e<!----></a><br>Author: Yongshun Liu <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Yongshun Liu &lt;<!----></span>yongshun@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/yongshun@chromium.org"><!---->yongshun@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed Oct 26 21:05:38 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Oct 26 21:05:38 2022<!----></span><br><br>[Merge to M108] saved_desks: Fix hide/show for overview item window and app window<span class="line"><!---->[Merge to M108] saved_desks: Fix hide/show for overview item window and app window<!----></span><br><br>This fixes 2 issues.<span class="line"><!---->This fixes 2 issues.<!----></span><br><br>1. Wrong shadow and header for the overview item when launching a<span class="line"><!---->1. Wrong shadow and header for the overview item when launching a<!----></span><br>template.<span class="line"><!---->template.<!----></span><br><br>During the launch process of a template, a new `OverviewItem` will be<span class="line"><!---->During the launch process of a template, a new `OverviewItem` will be<!----></span><br>added to the `OverviewGrid`. Since the library widget fade out animation<span class="line"><!---->added to the `OverviewGrid`. Since the library widget fade out animation<!----></span><br>takes precedence, the overview item window is hidden until the fade out<span class="line"><!---->takes precedence, the overview item window is hidden until the fade out<!----></span><br>animation is done, then the hide will be reverted. The problem is its<span class="line"><!---->animation is done, then the hide will be reverted. The problem is its<!----></span><br>shadow and header might not be sync'ed with the overview item window.<span class="line"><!---->shadow and header might not be sync'ed with the overview item window.<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to make sure the header and shadow show up only when the<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to make sure the header and shadow show up only when the<!----></span><br>overview item window is visible, and update the header and shadow when<span class="line"><!---->overview item window is visible, and update the header and shadow when<!----></span><br>reverting after the fade out animation.<span class="line"><!---->reverting after the fade out animation.<!----></span><br><br>2. Overview session unexpectedly being turned off when launching a<span class="line"><!---->2. Overview session unexpectedly being turned off when launching a<!----></span><br>template<span class="line"><!---->template<!----></span><br><br>So now we hide the real application window when in library view, this is<span class="line"><!---->So now we hide the real application window when in library view, this is<!----></span><br>to make sure dark/light change does not make it visible. However, when<span class="line"><!---->to make sure dark/light change does not make it visible. However, when<!----></span><br>we are reverting the hide, and still want to stay in overview, like when<span class="line"><!---->we are reverting the hide, and still want to stay in overview, like when<!----></span><br>launching a template, since overview session detects a window activation<span class="line"><!---->launching a template, since overview session detects a window activation<!----></span><br>event, the session would be soon turned off.<span class="line"><!---->event, the session would be soon turned off.<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to let `OverviewSession` ignore the activation for such<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to let `OverviewSession` ignore the activation for such<!----></span><br>window in `OnWindowActivating`. This also fixes the heap-use-after-free<span class="line"><!---->window in `OnWindowActivating`. This also fixes the heap-use-after-free<!----></span><br>security bug caused by overview session being turned off unexpectedly.<span class="line"><!---->security bug caused by overview session being turned off unexpectedly.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>aca00c63fdbf7d795929207bdb5aa25ddf73db3d<a class="undefined" Manual<span class="line"><!---->Test: Manual<!----></span><br>Bug:<span class="line"><!---->Bug:<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>b/254338856<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

    <mr-comment-list headinglevel="2"></mr-comment-list>
      
    <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>
      <mr-description></mr-description>
      <mr-comment-list headinglevel="2"></mr-comment-list>
      
    <!----></mr-issue-details>
              
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }

        by

        So it seems that in this case, when ShowWindowInOverview is doing its thing, it ends up shutting down overview mode, which means the object is destroyed.<span class="line"><!---->So it seems that in this case, when ShowWindowInOverview is doing its thing, it ends up shutting down overview mode, which means the object is destroyed.<!----></span><br><br>ScopedOverviewHideWindows::RemoveWindow, through a roundabout way, ends up activating a window and this causes overview mode to exit.<span class="line"><!---->ScopedOverviewHideWindows::RemoveWindow, through a roundabout way, ends up activating a window and this causes overview mode to exit.<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/wm/overview/overview_item.cc;l=1459;drc=fe9bb2cbc239b5aa37a4b59bc38f1f022b6f36b8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/wm/overview/overview_item.cc;l=1459;drc=fe9bb2cbc239b5aa37a4b59bc38f1f022b6f36b8"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/wm/overview/overview_item.cc;l=1459;drc=fe9bb2cbc239b5aa37a4b59bc38f1f022b6f36b8<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

Wrong shadow and header for the overview item when launching a<span class="line"><!---->1. Wrong shadow and header for the overview item when launching a<!----></span><br>template.<span class="line"><!---->template.<!----></span><br><br>During the launch process of a template, a new `OverviewItem` will be<span class="line"><!---->During the launch process of a template, a new `OverviewItem` will be<!----></span><br>added to the `OverviewGrid`. Since the library widget fade out animation<span class="line"><!---->added to the `OverviewGrid`. Since the library widget fade out animation<!----></span><br>takes precedence, the overview item window is hidden until the fade out<span class="line"><!---->takes precedence, the overview item window is hidden until the fade out<!----></span><br>animation is done, then the hide will be reverted. The problem is its<span class="line"><!---->animation is done, then the hide will be reverted. The problem is its<!----></span><br>shadow and header might not be sync'ed with the overview item window.<span class="line"><!---->shadow and header might not be sync'ed with the overview item window.<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to make sure the header and shadow show up only when the<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to make sure the header and shadow show up only when the<!----></span><br>overview item window is visible, and update the header and shadow when<span class="line"><!---->overview item window is visible, and update the header and shadow when<!----></span><br>reverting after the fade out animation.<span class="line"><!---->reverting after the fade out animation.<!----></span><br><br>2. Overview session unexpectedly being turned off when launching a<span class="line"><!---->2. Overview session unexpectedly being turned off when launching a<!----></span><br>template<span class="line"><!---->template<!----></span><br><br>So now we hide the real application window when in library view, this is<span class="line"><!---->So now we hide the real application window when in library view, this is<!----></span><br>to make sure dark/light change does not make it visible. However, when<span class="line"><!---->to make sure dark/light change does not make it visible. However, when<!----></span><br>we are reverting the hide, and still want to stay in overview, like when<span class="line"><!---->we are reverting the hide, and still want to stay in overview, like when<!----></span><br>launching a template, since overview session detects a window activation<span class="line"><!---->launching a template, since overview session detects a window activation<!----></span><br>event, the session would be soon turned off.<span class="line"><!---->event, the session would be soon turned off.<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to let `OverviewSession` ignore the activation for such<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to let `OverviewSession` ignore the activation for such<!----></span><br>window in `OnWindowActivating`. This also fixes the heap-use-after-free<span class="line"><!---->window in `OnWindowActivating`. This also fixes the heap-use-after-free<!----></span><br>security bug caused by overview session being turned off unexpectedly.<span class="line"><!---->security bug caused by overview session being turned off unexpectedly.<!----></span><br><br>Test: Manual<span class="line"><!---->Test: Manual<!----></span><br>Bug:<span class="line"><!---->Bug:<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> Wrong shadow and header for the overview item when launching a<span class="line"><!---->1. Wrong shadow and header for the overview item when launching a<!----></span><br>template.<span class="line"><!---->template.<!----></span><br><br>During the launch process of a template, a new `OverviewItem` will be<span class="line"><!---->During the launch process of a template, a new `OverviewItem` will be<!----></span><br>added to the `OverviewGrid`. Since the library widget fade out animation<span class="line"><!---->added to the `OverviewGrid`. Since the library widget fade out animation<!----></span><br>takes precedence, the overview item window is hidden until the fade out<span class="line"><!---->takes precedence, the overview item window is hidden until the fade out<!----></span><br>animation is done, then the hide will be reverted. The problem is its<span class="line"><!---->animation is done, then the hide will be reverted. The problem is its<!----></span><br>shadow and header might not be sync'ed with the overview item window.<span class="line"><!---->shadow and header might not be sync'ed with the overview item window.<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to make sure the header and shadow show up only when the<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to make sure the header and shadow show up only when the<!----></span><br>overview item window is visible, and update the header and shadow when<span class="line"><!---->overview item window is visible, and update the header and shadow when<!----></span><br>reverting after the fade out animation.<span class="line"><!---->reverting after the fade out animation.<!----></span><br><br>2. Overview session unexpectedly being turned off when launching a<span class="line"><!---->2. Overview session unexpectedly being turned off when launching a<!----></span><br>template<span class="line"><!---->template<!----></span><br><br>So now we hide the real application window when in library view, this is<span class="line"><!---->So now we hide the real application window when in library view, this is<!----></span><br>to make sure dark/light change does not make it visible. However, when<span class="line"><!---->to make sure dark/light change does not make it visible. However, when<!----></span><br>we are reverting the hide, and still want to stay in overview, like when<span class="line"><!---->we are reverting the hide, and still want to stay in overview, like when<!----></span><br>launching a template, since overview session detects a window activation<span class="line"><!---->launching a template, since overview session detects a window activation<!----></span><br>event, the session would be soon turned off.<span class="line"><!---->event, the session would be soon turned off.<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to let `OverviewSession` ignore the activation for such<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to let `OverviewSession` ignore the activation for such<!----></span><br>window in `OnWindowActivating`. This also fixes the heap-use-after-free<span class="line"><!---->window in `OnWindowActivating`. This also fixes the heap-use-after-free<!----></span><br>security bug caused by overview session being turned off unexpectedly.<span class="line"><!---->security bug caused by overview session being         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        So it seems that in this case, when ShowWindowInOverview is doing its thing, it ends up shutting down overview mode, which means the object is destroyed.<span class="line"><!---->So it seems that in this case, when ShowWindowInOverview is doing its thing, it ends up shutting down overview mode, which means the object is destroyed.<!----></span><br><br>ScopedOverviewHideWindows::RemoveWindow, through a roundabout way, ends up activating a window and this causes overview mode to exit.<span class="line"><!---->ScopedOverviewHideWindows::RemoveWindow, through a roundabout way, ends up activating a window and this causes overview mode to exit.<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/wm/overview/overview_item.cc;l=1459;drc=fe9bb2cbc239b5aa37a4b59bc38f1f022b6f36b8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/wm/overview/overview_item.cc;l=1459;drc=fe9bb2cbc239b5aa37a4b59bc38f1f022b6f36b8"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/wm/overview/overview_item.cc;l=1459;drc=fe9bb2cbc239b5aa37a4b59bc38f1f022b6f36b8<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

Wrong shadow and header for the overview item when launching a<span class="line"><!---->1. Wrong shadow and header for the overview item when launching a<!----></span><br>template.<span class="line"><!---->template.<!----></span><br><br>During the launch process of a template, a new `OverviewItem` will be<span class="line"><!---->During the launch process of a template, a new `OverviewItem` will be<!----></span><br>added to the `OverviewGrid`. Since the library widget fade out animation<span class="line"><!---->added to the `OverviewGrid`. Since the library widget fade out animation<!----></span><br>takes precedence, the overview item window is hidden until the fade out<span class="line"><!---->takes precedence, the overview item window is hidden until the fade out<!----></span><br>animation is done, then the hide will be reverted. The problem is its<span class="line"><!---->animation is done, then the hide will be reverted. The problem is its<!----></span><br>shadow and header might not be sync'ed with the overview item window.<span class="line"><!---->shadow and header might not be sync'ed with the overview item window.<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to make sure the header and shadow show up only when the<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to make sure the header and shadow show up only when the<!----></span><br>overview item window is visible, and update the header and shadow when<span class="line"><!---->overview item window is visible, and update the header and shadow when<!----></span><br>reverting after the fade out animation.<span class="line"><!---->reverting after the fade out animation.<!----></span><br><br>2. Overview session unexpectedly being turned off when launching a<span class="line"><!---->2. Overview session unexpectedly being turned off when launching a<!----></span><br>template<span class="line"><!---->template<!----></span><br><br>So now we hide the real application window when in library view, this is<span class="line"><!---->So now we hide the real application window when in library view, this is<!----></span><br>to make sure dark/light change does not make it visible. However, when<span class="line"><!---->to make sure dark/light change does not make it visible. However, when<!----></span><br>we are reverting the hide, and still want to stay in overview, like when<span class="line"><!---->we are reverting the hide, and still want to stay in overview, like when<!----></span><br>launching a template, since overview session detects a window activation<span class="line"><!---->launching a template, since overview session detects a window activation<!----></span><br>event, the session would be soon turned off.<span class="line"><!---->event, the session would be soon turned off.<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to let `OverviewSession` ignore the activation for such<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to let `OverviewSession` ignore the activation for such<!----></span><br>window in `OnWindowActivating`. This also fixes the heap-use-after-free<span class="line"><!---->window in `OnWindowActivating`. This also fixes the heap-use-after-free<!----></span><br>security bug caused by overview session being turned off unexpectedly.<span class="line"><!---->security bug caused by overview session being turned off unexpectedly.<!----></span><br><br>Test: Manual<span class="line"><!---->Test: Manual<!----></span><br>Bug:<span class="line"><!---->Bug:<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> Wrong shadow and header for the overview item when launching a<span class="line"><!---->1. Wrong shadow and header for the overview item when launching a<!----></span><br>template.<span class="line"><!---->template.<!----></span><br><br>During the launch process of a template, a new `OverviewItem` will be<span class="line"><!---->During the launch process of a template, a new `OverviewItem` will be<!----></span><br>added to the `OverviewGrid`. Since the library widget fade out animation<span class="line"><!---->added to the `OverviewGrid`. Since the library widget fade out animation<!----></span><br>takes precedence, the overview item window is hidden until the fade out<span class="line"><!---->takes precedence, the overview item window is hidden until the fade out<!----></span><br>animation is done, then the hide will be reverted. The problem is its<span class="line"><!---->animation is done, then the hide will be reverted. The problem is its<!----></span><br>shadow and header might not be sync'ed with the overview item window.<span class="line"><!---->shadow and header might not be sync'ed with the overview item window.<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to make sure the header and shadow show up only when the<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to make sure the header and shadow show up only when the<!----></span><br>overview item window is visible, and update the header and shadow when<span class="line"><!---->overview item window is visible, and update the header and shadow when<!----></span><br>reverting after the fade out animation.<span class="line"><!---->reverting after the fade out animation.<!----></span><br><br>2. Overview session unexpectedly being turned off when launching a<span class="line"><!---->2. Overview session unexpectedly being turned off when launching a<!----></span><br>template<span class="line"><!---->template<!----></span><br><br>So now we hide the real application window when in library view, this is<span class="line"><!---->So now we hide the real application window when in library view, this is<!----></span><br>to make sure dark/light change does not make it visible. However, when<span class="line"><!---->to make sure dark/light change does not make it visible. However, when<!----></span><br>we are reverting the hide, and still want to stay in overview, like when<span class="line"><!---->we are reverting the hide, and still want to stay in overview, like when<!----></span><br>launching a template, since overview session detects a window activation<span class="line"><!---->launching a template, since overview session detects a window activation<!----></span><br>event, the session would be soon turned off.<span class="line"><!---->event, the session would be soon turned off.<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to let `OverviewSession` ignore the activation for such<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to let `OverviewSession` ignore the activation for such<!----></span><br>window in `OnWindowActivating`. This also fixes the heap-use-after-free<span class="line"><!---->window in `OnWindowActivating`. This also fixes the heap-use-after-free<!----></span><br>security bug caused by overview session being turned off unexpectedly.<span class="line"><!---->security bug caused by overview session being         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
